channel.title: Client Problems
channel.description:
[s]When I compiled and made my client, and ran it, everything worked fine! It was great! Then I wanted to start on the webclient and change the regular client to .JAR, so I used JARMaker and made "TeleScape.JAR" using this guide:
http://frugooscape.net/smf/index.php/topic,945.0.html
I ran it.. then it logs me in and hangs right away on "Loading... Please wait...". I wanted to know what the error was.. so I made the JAR again this time [b]with[/b] a .bat file to go with it. I ran it again, it hangs again, and I get the error ...
But I'm pretty sure around 300-400mb of ram available is fine to run the .jar (unless that error does not mean my computer's memory :o ) Does anybody know why that doesn't work? I want people to download the .JAR only not everything in my client folder. :( [/s]
And when I make the webclient.. it says "Requesting Title Screen" then switches right away to "Retrying in 5 seconds.." And again, agian, etc.. For the webclient i made a webclient.html page with this code: [code] <html> <title>TeleScape Webclient v.02</title> <center><applet name="app" width="765" height="503" archive="http://--website--/TeleScape.jar" code="client"> </applet></center> </html> [/code] And uploaded webclient.html and TeleScape.jar to my FTP Server.
Anybody know the solutions for these problems? Any answer would be great. Thanks!

item.title: Client Problems
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Hmm… So does anybody know how to make a webclient?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2007, 03:55:07 PM[/size][hr]I wish more people helped out :S Well… I thought of a start maybe… I have to change the Title Screen addeess from just telescape.jpeg to http://–website–/telescape.jpeg … and stuff like that… I doubt im right though.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Problems
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Wait a second… When I make a .JAR I have to include the run.BAT file?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2007, 02:33:00 PM[/size][hr]EDIT: Nevermind, i have a run.bat in the jar file… The client works… Webclient doesnt…

How do I configure my client to run as a webclient?

Read full topic

item.title: Client Problems
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

No, I mean …
Whats your run.bat say?
Post it here.
I mean the inside code.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Problems
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“I Am Olan14, post:2, topic:118124”]You have to edit a client for it to work as a webclient.
The heapspace means its taking to much memory.[/quote]
Alright… then what do I edit for it to be a webclient?

And why is it taking too much memory? (BTW, its 36MB Big, and ones like the official MoparScape are like 500KB… why is that?)

Read full topic

item.title: Client Problems
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

You have to edit a client for it to work as a webclient.
The heapspace means its taking to much memory.

item.title: Client Problems
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[s]When I compiled and made my client, and ran it, everything worked fine! It was great! Then I wanted to start on the webclient and change the regular client to .JAR, so I used JARMaker and made “TeleScape.JAR” using this guide:

http://frugooscape.net/smf/index.php/topic,945.0.html

I ran it… then it logs me in and hangs right away on “Loading… Please wait…”. I wanted to know what the error was… so I made the JAR again this time with a .bat file to go with it. I ran it again, it hangs again, and I get the error
…

But I’m pretty sure around 300-400mb of ram available is fine to run the .jar (unless that error does not mean my computer’s memory :o ) Does anybody know why that doesn’t work? I want people to download the .JAR only not everything in my client folder. [/s]

And when I make the webclient… it says “Requesting Title Screen” then switches right away to “Retrying in 5 seconds…” And again, agian, etc… For the webclient i made a webclient.html page with this code:

<html>
<title>TeleScape Webclient v.02</title>
<center><applet name="app" width="765" height="503" 
archive="http://--website--/TeleScape.jar" code="client">
</applet></center>
</html>

And uploaded webclient.html and TeleScape.jar to my FTP Server.

Anybody know the solutions for these problems? Any answer would be great. Thanks!

Read full topic
